newsitem.title: USA: Bonneville Thurs surplus power prices unchanged.
newsitem.headline: Bonneville Thurs surplus power prices unchanged.

text.p: The Bonneville Power Administration (BPA) left offer prices for surplus power on Thursday unchanged, the agency said Wednesday.

BPA continued to offer up to 500 megawatts of firm power during a block of peak demand hours at $12.00 per megawatt hour (MWh) for Northwest deliveries and $13.00 for California-Oregon border (COB) sales.
Thursday firm off-peak power (hours ending 0100-0600 and 2300-2400 PST) was offered at $9.00 for all deliveries.
Prices for non-firm power during peak hours (0800-1000, 1800-2000 PST) were also unchanged at $14.00 (Northwest) and $15.00 (COB).
Non-firm prices for shoulder hours (0700, 1100-1700 and 2100-2200) were at $10.00 for Northwest and $11.00 for COB.
Non-firm prices for off-peak (0100-0500 and 2400 PST) hours on Thursday were posted at $9.00 for all deliveries.
BPA also offered displacement power during off-peak hours on Thursday at $7.00 per MWh.
